That being said, we also understand that customers have different phases of their cloud journey. We want to understand your migrations for your EC2, Windows SQL Server and Oracle RDS workloads so that we can help you sequence or plan for modernizations for those workloads as they land on aws. And also we understand that a lot of our customers are talking about Gen AI, talking about unlocking data assets. Data is your business. So we also want to understand if you've got priorities right now that are locked up by legacy architectures, this is a good opportunity for us to help you get ahead of those Gen AI priorities and really leverage this modernization lab to invest and kind of get unlock those data assets so that you can prioritize in those types of activities. We can again run in a couple of different formats. One, we can focus in on one specific application where we just get really deep on one application, but also depending on the size of the workloads that are getting migrated into aws, we can also operate in a portfolio management or sort of a portfolio assessment approach where we look comprehensively at all of your EC2 windows and SQL Server workloads and help you prioritize modern modernization projects or many AMLs tied to this program and help you sequence sort of what an overall portfolio strategy roadmap looks like. But what we can also do is just focus in on the application level if you're really just focused in on one or two specific core applications. Wanted to highlight that this is an option, but again, application and portfolio assessment, we can operate in a couple different flavors as well. In terms of what we do, what we consider to be our bread and butter. As you see here, we've got a lot of different modernization pathways that our solution architects want to talk about with you all on the left hand side of your screen modernization pathways number one and number two, those are going to be what we consider our qualifying workloads. So the way that you qualify into an AML engagement is by tagging $1 million of EC2 Windows or SQL Server. And that's going to be your qualifying metric to unlock. Now we're going to help you define pathways to do a. NET modernization to move you to NET Core, to enable you to move from EC2 Windows to Linux. Or if again database is your priority, if you've got EC2 SQL or RDS SQL, SQL Byll, we can dig into that and help you find strategies and pathways to get you into Aurora and other AWS purpose built databases. That's what we consider our qualifying modernization pathways. So we want to work with you all to better understand what your DevOps modernization priorities are as well as we're considering this top to bottom application modernization priorities. B: Good, thanks. Really appreciate the brief conversation around licensing. It's something that a lot of our customers want to understand a little bit more and it's often a priority so it's good context bringing it back to sort of how AML supports Again these are the kinds of conversations the prioritization of features versus cost optimization. These are the things we can also explore through the technical discovery. So but really these are the things that are our solution architects and our delivery teams do really well is modernization of these types of workloads and really considering it's part of architecture that is aligned with Lightbox or customers objectives. So I want to give you all an overview of the way that one AML standard eight week lab works. So what would happen is if we collaboratively work together, you all identify a workload that is a million dollars of EC2 Windows or SQL Server ARR. That is by the way what we would do then is collaboratively start on what is our AML Technical Discovery phase. Now this is the first phase of the AML engagement and it is free of cost. There is no cost associated with committing to and being a part of the AML Technical discovery. All we really ask is that a customer says hey, I like the idea of this program. We're planning on using this lab function and we're ready to start talking to you all and talking to one of your solution architects about designing a cloud native architecture for one of our applications that is business critical importance to us for modernization. The way that our AML technical discoveries work. AML solution architects specialized only in these types of modernizations would run a series of workshops with your team, your engineers, your database experts, anyone from the application side that needs to be a part of the conversation and key decision makers and what they're going to do is run a series of workshops. This can either be done as an on site, you know, three full days we'll call it or remotely with a series of six to eight two hour sessions with your teams over the course of one to two months and we're going to dig in with you, we're going to understand your current pain points of that application, we're going to understand what your target priorities look like and your modernization outcomes look like. We're going to do code reviews and database schema reviews and collaboratively kind of document that legacy Microsoft or legacy SQL architecture and work with you all to define a cloud native cloud optimized architecture that really kind of gets you all moving into the modernization direction that you're looking to achieve. Now the AML Engagement Specification, that's the document that comes out of the AML Technical Discovery. It's going to document your current state, the collaboratively aligned upon market state architecture as well as a series of outcomes that you all are looking to achieve in the hands on proserve delivered lab. That engagement specifications reviewed by your teams aligned on approved and only at that point at the conclusion of the AML Technical Discovery would you receive a statement of work for that Pro Serve delivery podcast. Hands on delivery Lab to onboard. Now one other cool benefit of the AML is that you do get 15 seats of architecting with AWS. That's a three day AWS classroom based training delivered digitally, but classroom based training to support your engineers to work towards a AWS certified Solution Architect certification. So again that would be a cost neutral benefit. So wanted to highlight that nice little deal sweetener as well. Now coming out of the AML Technical Discovery again so far free of charge, only at the end of it are you getting a statement of work. That's when we move into the AML Phase 1 modernization lab. This is an eight week lab that is delivered by the AWS Proserve team Professional services and what you're going to get here is 190 person days or approximately four to five Proserve consultants that onboard into your environment for eight weeks. They are going to be dedicated to your teams. They'll onboard into your environment, work alongside your teams, work within your tooling to start to make progress on the cloud native architecture that was defined in Technical Discovery and work on that lab scope that was defined in Technical Discovery. They're going to bring their expertise in these types of modernizations as well as modernization at scale tooling that is either developed by AWS or proprietary to professional services as well as kind of bringing that best practices and sort of best knowledge or expert knowledge to support your teams in kicking off this modernization. So it's going to be eight weeks, four to five proserve Consultants fully engaged, operating alongside your teams and within your tooling coming out of that phase. One modernization lab. That's when customers get their first service credit payment. So it's going to be 50% of the cost of the pro served. Billings that are incurred during this hands on delivery lab are immediately coming back to our customers at the conclusion of the hands on lab as well as the cost of the training comes back right at the conclusion of the hands on lab. Now those eight weeks are meant to set in motion an accelerated modernization pathway for your team. Hands on support so you've got tangible progress, something that is like an MVP for your teams of that modernized architecture so that you're happy, so that you have in hand one tangible progress but also an AML roadmap that that outlines the additional steps to take and the path forward for your teams to complete the modernization that was defined in the technical discovery in our third phase, which is the DIY or do it yourself modernization phase. This DIY phase is going to be when the customer teams take on the modernization project that was started in the hands on lab and work on it through completion until it's pushed into production. Now that being said, our team continues to stay in contact and provide post lab support and guidance. Our solution architects would be meeting with your teams bimonthly to provide architectural and advisory support if there is additional research needed on your solution. If you're encountering an issue with the architecture and something needs to be reworked, that architect is going to be available to you all to help troubleshoot those issues and find pathways forward. Additionally, we'll have monthly health checks with the entire project team run by myself as a BDM where we're going to be keeping tabs on risks, issues, blockers that are coming up on your side that AWS can find pathways forward to. Now the supplement service credit that comes back to customers happens when you hit the modernization complete for your workload. And we measure that through tagging of that legacy workload. When we see the legacy resources deprecated by 75%, that's when we consider that workload to be modernization complete. We recognize that when you're looking at an application or a workload, not every single resource or instance is going to be deprecated. There may be things that for whatever reason just aren't worth the ROI to invest in modernization or have to stay put depending on customer commitments. So that 75% EC2 Windows or SQL Server reduction for the targeted workload is that second trigger point so that you recoup the remainder of anything that's paid out and you get that back through service credits. So overall this program typically takes customers between 6 to 15 months depending on the complexity of the architecture, the resources committed and the modernization pathway that's defined in technical discovery. So what's unique here about this program is again this cost neutrality as well as that hands on proserve lab support and the long running support that customers get through the phase two DIY progress.
